constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: KEYACH Name: Key Area of Change
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Application under S73 to vary condition 2 of Planning permission 19/00704/HOU (Proposed single storey rear, two storey side and rear dormer loft extensions. Including internal alteration to create open plan living to dwelling house) .The proposed amendments include: changes to the width and roof profile of the single storey rear extension, changes to the dimensions and design of the front door and windows, changes to the external finishes on the property, and the lowering of  the cil height of the front ground floor  windows
decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and/or re-enacting that Order) no windows, other than those shown on the approved plans shall at any time be placed in the side elevation of the building/extension hereby permitted without the grant of a separate planning permission from the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises from overlooking and loss of privacy.
Condition 16 - RBK Environmental Health officer has reviewed the information provided and is satisfied this can now be discharged.
Condition 19 - RBK Highways Engineer has reviewed the information provided and is satisfied this can now be discharged.

Please note that the quality of advice will be proportionate to the level of information provided, therefore it is to the applicants benefit to provide as much supporting information as possible for the proposal. eg: plans and elevations, photographs and supporting documents.

Please submit a copy of a site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.
